page.title: 01DAISY HILL FARM
page.content: Mr Howe of{Daisy Hill Farm}is the owner of a typical livestock farm in the Langsett area. He has lived there for 26 years and has seen and taken part in many of the changes. His farm comprises of 3.5 thousand acres of moorland on which he grazes 200 sheep and 240 acres of grassland on which he grazes 200 cows and grows silage and hay. Most of the land was poor to start with and he is still in the process of reclaiming 4 of the fields of gorse north west of Langsett. The farm is capital intensive with only the farmer and his two sons working although they do have the occasional help of pupils on three weeks experience courses. The busiest times of the year are Spring (lambing) and Summer (silage and hay). The livestock has to be kept indoors longer than on lowland farms in Winter
